titleStmt.title: Register of cultivators, with their lands and crops.

revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: (Lines 1-9) Petesouchos the crocodile god, represented by Petesouchos son of Pakurris ï¿½ 5 arouras renting for 16 artabas. Toward these he is to pay 8 art. wheat; 8 1/3 art. barley, which equals 5 of wheat; and 60 copper pieces, equivalent to 3 art. of wheat. Crop: 3 arouras in wheat, rental 9 1/2 art.; 2 arouras in grass, rental 6 1/2 art. Petesouchos the crocodile god, represented by Marres son of Pakurris, 4 arouras at 4 1/2 1/3 1/12 art. apiece in the West Kerkeouris Basin, 19 2/3 artabas. Toward these he is to pay 14 2/3 art. wheat and 8 1/3 art. barley, which equals 5 of wheat. Crops: 2 1/2 arouras in wheat, 12 1/3 art.; 1 1/2 arouras in arakos, 7 1/3 art. Petesouchos the crocodile god, represented by Mestasutmis son of Pakurris, 5 arouras at 4 1/2 1/3 1/12 in the South Third Basin, 24 1/2 1/12 artabas. Toward these he is to pay 14 1/3 1/12 art. wheat and 16 2/3 art. barley, which equals 10 of wheat. Crops: 3 arouras in wheat, 14 1/2 1/4 art.; 1 in lentils, 4 1/2 1/3 1/12 art.; total, 5 arouras, 24 1/2 1/12 art.

listBibl.bibl: P.Tebt., I.246; P.Tebt., IV.1104 On lines 4 & 7 see Crawford, D. Kerkeosiris, p. 110-111.
